eu_initiatives:
The goal of EAPN is to establish across Europe a democratic and effective network of voluntary groups or non-governmental organisations (NGOs) working against poverty, which shall primarily be an expression of the desire of people experiencing poverty to initiate and effect change in the structures that keep people in a marginalised position. The explicit and main purpose of groups that join the Network must be to empower people and groups experiencing poverty and social exclusion to fulfill their responsibilities, to exercise their rights, to break their isolation and counter their social exclusion.  
 
The Network shall pursue three main objectives: 
    To promote and enhance the effectiveness of actions against poverty and social exclusion;  
    To help shape social policies and design action programmes  
    To lobby for and with people and groups experiencing poverty and social exclusion.  
 
While EAPN is committed to the eradication of poverty globally the primary focus of our activities is on the eradication of poverty within the member states of the European Union.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar

goals__remit:
The goal of EAPN is to establish across Europe a democratic and effective network of voluntary groups or non-governmental organisations (NGOs) working against poverty, which shall primarily be an expression of the desire of people experiencing poverty to initiate and effect change in the structures that keep people in a marginalised position. The explicit and main purpose of groups that join the Network must be to empower people and groups experiencing poverty and social exclusion to fulfil their responsibilities, to exercise their rights, to break their isolation and counter their social exclusion.  
 
The Network shall pursue three main objectives: 
    To promote and enhance the effectiveness of actions against poverty and social exclusion;  
    To help shape social policies and design action programmes  
    To lobby for and with people and groups experiencing poverty and social exclusion.  
 
While EAPN is committed to the eradication of poverty globally the primary focus of our activities is on the eradication of poverty within the member states of the European Union.  
 
EAPN is committed to transparency about EU interest representation.   
 
Our registration is based on the guidelines for transparent registration developed by the Civil Society Contact Group and ALTER-EU.  You can find the guidelines on “http://www.act4europe.org or http://www.alter-eu.org” 
 
EAPN as an “interest representative” of people experiencing poverty and social exclusion and the organisations who defend their interests or in which they participate at regional, national and EU and international levels.
relevant_communication:
The Publications listed below give a clear indication of the areas we work on. It also shows our communication activities and the event s we organised were linked to the main publications.  
 
Getting Results on Poverty and the Social Pillar? | EAPN Response to the Annual Growth Survey Package 2018 (January 11, 2018) 
 
Social Rights or Social Plight? | EAPN Assessment of the 2017 National Reform Programmes (September 27, 2017) 
 
Make Social Rights the beating heart of Europe! | EAPN position on the European Pillar of Social Rights 
(September 11, 2017) 
 
Key messages from EAPN’s 2017 conference: Learning from the past to beyond 2020 – What EU strategy to fight poverty, social exclusion & inequality? (August 9, 2017)  
 
More Social Europe in the European Semester? | EAPN Assessment of the 2017 Country-Specific Recommendations (June 9, 2017) 
 
Making progress on Social Europe? Poverty reduction, social rights and standards | EAPN Assessment of the Country Reports and Proposals for Country- Specific Recommendations 2017 (May 2017) 
 
Nobody left behind | EAPN Booklet on Services (Jan 2017) 
 
Inclusive Labour Markets – Building pathway approaches to quality employment (Jan 2017) 
 
EAPN’s Analysis of the 2017 Annual Growth Survey & Joint Employment Report | Delivering on the Promises of a better Social Europe? (Dec 2016) 
 
Energy Poverty Handbook, co-authored with MEP Tamas Meszerics (Greens, Hungary), Building Performance Institute Europe, & Housing Europe (Nov 2016) 
 
EAPN Assessment of the National Reform Programmes 2016 – What Progress on Social Europe? (Oct 2016) 
 
EAPN Position Paper on the European Pillar of Social Rights – Last Chance for Social Europe? (Sept 2016) 
 
EAPN Assessment of the Country Reports and Proposals for Country-Specific Recommendations 2016. (Apr 2016) 
 
Barometer Report: Monitoring the implementation of the 20% of the European Social Fund that should be devoted to fight against poverty 2014-2020. (Mar 2016) 
 
EAPN Booklet on social innovation (Mar 2016) 
 
EAPN Response to the Annual Growth Survey & Joint Employment Report (Dec 2015)

EAPN’s October’s Policy conference report – Can the semester deliver on poverty and participation? (Dec 2015) 
     
EAPN Assessment of the National Reform Programmes 2015 (Oct 2015) 
 
EU Semester Alliance: Letter to European Commission President Juncker upon adoption of the 2015 Country-Specific Recommendations (Sept 2015) 
 
EAPN briefing on Juncker's EU Investment Plan and the European Fund for Strategic Investment (EFSI) (July 2015) 
 
EAPN full assessment of the European Commission's Country-Specific Recommendations 2015 (June 2015) 
 
EAPN Letter to the EPSCO Council & Employment Council (June 2015) 
 
EAPN contribution to EC Consultation on long-term unemployment (May 2015) 
 
EAPN Proposals on the new Commission's Integrated Guidelines (April 2015) 
 
EAPN report Making Progress on Europe 2020: Investing in people for a fairer EU.

EAPN Toolkit on Engaging with Europe 2020 & the European Semester (Mar 2015) 
 
EAPN Letter to the EPSCO Council (Mar 2015)
